tool_description: A comprehensive API offering statistical data on UK residents based on ONS census data, covering highest levels of education, gender, age, and health. The API supports queries by postcode for granular insights.
name: UK Resident Statistics
title: UK Resident Statistics

api_list.name: education data
api_list.description: Retrieve highest levels of education queried by postcode
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://uk-resident-statistics.p.rapidapi.com/highest-edu/data/W1A 1AB"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "uk-resident-statistics.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())
api_list.convert_code:
import requests

url = "https://uk-resident-statistics.p.rapidapi.com/highest-edu/data/{postcode}"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "uk-resident-statistics.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

api_list.name: recorded sex
api_list.description: returns observed count of sex from 2021 census. The options available were "Male" and "Female"
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://uk-resident-statistics.p.rapidapi.com/sex/data/W1A 1AB"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "uk-resident-statistics.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

api_list.name: age data
api_list.description:
Age data queried by postcode, split into 6 categories grouped as : 
Aged 15 years and under
Aged 16 to 24 years
Aged 25 to 34 years
Aged 35 to 49 years
Aged 50 to 64 years
Aged 65 years and over
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://uk-resident-statistics.p.rapidapi.com/age/data/W1A 1AB"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "uk-resident-statistics.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())
